name: The Best Baked Alfredo Spaghetti
author: ardomagala
summary: This is an amazingly cheese-rich dish. I love making this to take to friends' homes as a drop off meal. It gets rave reviews every time! The recipe is adapted from a restaurant in the Mall of America called Tucci Benucch. I attended the restaurant at a business meeting and they gave us a recipe for the baked spaghetti that I have made a few changes to. My husband prefers it without the marinara/meatball topping, but if you're looking to stretch the recipe that's a great way to do it.
ingredients: 1 pound shredded mozzarella and provolone cheese blend
2 (16 ounce) jars Alfredo sauce (such as Ragu®)
1 (16 ounce) jar marinara sauce, or to taste  (Optional)
1 (16 ounce) package frozen cooked meatballs, or to taste  (Optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until halfway cooked through, about 6 minutes
Stir provolone cheese blend, 1 jar  , drained spaghetti, ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, and eggs together in a bowl
Cover the dish with aluminum foil
Bake in the preheated oven until hot and bubbling, 60 to 75 minutes
Remove foil from baking dish and top spaghetti with remaining Alfredo sauce
Stir marinara sauce and meatballs together in a saucepan; bring to a simmer, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until meatballs are heated through, 15 to 25 minutes
Spoon meatballs and marinara over baked spaghetti
